content:
• Wednesday, March 13, 2013
  • SIGM

    More on Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM) Q4 misses big on a per share basis. Net losses widened...

    More on Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM) Q4 misses big on a per share basis. Net losses widened despite higher revenue, as restructuring and cost-reduction expenses hurt its bottom line. For Q1, the company anticipates revenue between $49M - $52M, at the low end of Street projections of $52M. However, shares are higher in the post-trading session as the company reiterated that it expects to return to profitability in the current quarter. Shares +6.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 PM
  • DCTH

    More on Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH): Q4 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on the...

    More on Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH): Q4 beats on a per share basis but comes up short on the revenue side. SG&A expenses were higher, primarily due to increased EU commercialization expenses, but were largely offset by lower R&D expenses, which reflected lower consulting expenses following the submission FDA applications for its chemosaturation system. The company also filed a shelf registration to sell up to $50M in stock. Shares -8.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm (NASDAQ:ZIOP) is getting whipped about in thin after-hours trade this evening following...

    Ziopharm (NASDAQ:ZIOP) is getting whipped about in thin after-hours trade this evening following unconfirmed reports that SAC Capital had taken a 5.2% stake in the company. After briefly popping +1.25%, the stock has since fallen back, now trading -0.9%. It's also worth noting that the company also presented at the Barclay's Healthcare Conference a few hours ago as well. (Presentation Webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • JIVE

    Jive Software (NASDAQ:JIVE) is down 7% over the last two days. A Tuesday presentation from CFO...

    Jive Software (NASDAQ:JIVE) is down 7% over the last two days. A Tuesday presentation from CFO Bryan LeBlanc at a UBS conference (transcript) could be a factor. Though LeBlanc's initial remarks were mostly positive, he was grilled in the Q&A about non-renewals, the pace at which deferred revenue will be recognized, and Jive's relationship with partner/customer SAP. The enterprise social networking software firm is a favorite of tech shorts - 28% of the float was shorted as of Feb. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • TLRD

    More from Men's Wearhouse (MW) Q4 results: In comp store sales, Men's Wearhouse +1% (61% of...

    More from Men's Wearhouse (MW) Q4 results: In comp store sales, Men's Wearhouse +1% (61% of total Q4 sales), K&G -5.7%, Moore's -5.5%. Approves a new $200M share repurchase program. Hires Jefferies to assist in evaluating strategic alternatives for its K&G operations. Shares +13.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • FTK

    Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.44. Revenue of $76.7M (+2.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Flotek Industries (NYSE:FTK): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.44. Revenue of $76.7M (+2.4% Y/Y) misses by $1.2M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • TLRD

    Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q4 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $608.4M (+8.2% Y/Y) misses by...

    Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q4 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $608.4M (+8.2% Y/Y) misses by $1.6M. Shares +11% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • RCPI

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: STSI +3%. CBK +3%. ARCO +2%. ARUN +2%. BFAM +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: STSI +3%. CBK +3%. ARCO +2%. ARUN +2%. BFAM +2%.
    After-hours top losers: ANAD -10%. VRA -8%. ICON -4%. ETFC -4%. SSNC -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • VRA

    More on Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q4 beats on all counts as total sales rose 21% Y/Y. Gross...

    More on Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA): Q4 beats on all counts as total sales rose 21% Y/Y. Gross margin widened to 57.9% from 56.4%, as the company cited operational efficiencies, lower freight costs and a favorable channel mix. Same-store sales decreased 0.4%. Direct revenues +27% on growth across all channels, while indirect revenue +11%. However, the company issued downbeat guidance for Q1, now expecting an EPS of $0.20 to $0.22 per share on revenue in the range of $120M to $122M. The Street view is for an EPS of $0.35 per share on revenue of $131M. Shares -8.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANAD

    Anadigics (NASDAQ:ANAD) -10.4% AH after announcing a public stock offering of undisclosed size....

    Anadigics (NASDAQ:ANAD) -10.4% AH after announcing a public stock offering of undisclosed size. The RF component maker only says it will use the proceeds for "working capital and general corporate purposes." As of Dec. 28, Anadigics had $51.4M in cash/investments on its balance sheet, and no debt. However, the company has been steadily burning cash, and more losses are expected. (prospectus)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY) +2.4% AH, adding to the 8.2% gain it saw in regular trading on news of a...

    BlackBerry (BBRY) +2.4% AH, adding to the 8.2% gain it saw in regular trading on news of a 1M-unit BB10 phone order (perhaps from AT&T or Verizon?). Wells Fargo says it's now more comfortable with its forecast for 2.5M May quarter BB10 shipments. FQ4 (Feb. quarter) results arrive on March 28.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 15 Comments
  • ETFC

    Citadel is unloading the rest of its E*Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) stake, with the broker announcing a...

    Citadel is unloading the rest of its E*Trade (NASDAQ:ETFC) stake, with the broker announcing a secondary offering of about 27.4M shares, roughly 10% of the company. Stock is down 4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • OFC

    Corporate Office Properties Trust (NYSE:OFC) will recognize a Q1 loss of $5.3M due to the early...

    Corporate Office Properties Trust (NYSE:OFC) will recognize a Q1 loss of $5.3M due to the early repayment of a loan. The company is also redeeming its 7.625% preferred shares and will record a $2.9M loss for that in Q2. The actions are expected to knock $0.09/share off 2013 FFO, now expected between $1.74-$1.84. Company also launches a 3.9M share secondary offering. Shares -1.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CBK

    Christopher & Banks (NYSE:CBK): Q4 EPS of -$0.11 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $116M misses by...

    Christopher & Banks (NYSE:CBK): Q4 EPS of -$0.11 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $116M misses by $4.66M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • SIGM

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM): Q4 EPS of -$0.54 misses by $0.29. Revenue of $44.2M (-31% Y/Y)...

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM): Q4 EPS of -$0.54 misses by $0.29. Revenue of $44.2M (-31% Y/Y) beats by $0.77M. Shares -1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC's (WFR -13.4%) soft guidance and a report the Wuxi, China government will take control of...

    MEMC's (WFR -13.4%) soft guidance and a report the Wuxi, China government will take control of Suntech (STP -23.6%) ignited a solar selloff (TAN -5%). LDK (LDK -12.7%), whose financial position is arguably only a little better than Suntech's, was especially hard-hit, but ReneSola (SOL -5.3%), Yingli (YGE -3.4%), Trina (TSL -3.5%), SunPower (SPWR -2.7%), and First Solar (FSLR -2%) also saw losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 5 Comments
  • GLT

    Shares of Glatfelter (GLT +7%) have powered higher all day after this morning's news that the...

    Shares of Glatfelter (GLT +7%) have powered higher all day after this morning's news that the manufacturer of specialty papers had acquired specialty non-wovens manufacturer Dresden Papier for ~$209M. GLT expects the acquisition to be immediately accretive to EPS by ~$0.25 annually.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY +8.3%) has received an order for 1M BB10 phones from one of its "established...

    BlackBerry (BBRY +8.3%) has received an order for 1M BB10 phones from one of its "established partners" (exactly whom remains a mystery). The announcement has sent shares flying higher over the final hour of trading. Also: Verizon (NYSE:VZ) says it will begin selling the Z10 on March 28, and will start taking pre-orders tomorrow. As was rumored, the carrier will have exclusive access to a white version of the device.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 42 Comments
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE -3.6%) plans to sell the Rio Colorado fertilizer project in Argentina to recoup the...

    Vale (VALE -3.6%) plans to sell the Rio Colorado fertilizer project in Argentina to recoup the $2.2B it has invested in the suspended potash mine, railroad and port complex, Reuters reports. A sale would come just four years after Vale bought the project, then in the feasibility study phase, from Rio Tinto as part of an $850M deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • BLRX

    Bioline RX (BLRX -1.8%) gives back the days gains and more, despite receiving approval from...

    Bioline RX (BLRX -1.8%) gives back the days gains and more, despite receiving approval from French regulatory authorities to start Phase I/II trials for BL-8020, an oral, interferon-free treatment for the Hepatitis C virus. The study, to be conducted at two clinical sites in France, will evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of BL-8020 in patients infected with HCV, and includes HCV-infected patients of any genotype who have previously failed or relapsed following treatment with the standard-of-care.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • NTR

    Potash (POT -1.5%) seeks to soothe Israeli fears over a possible acquisition of Israel...

    Potash (POT -1.5%) seeks to soothe Israeli fears over a possible acquisition of Israel Chemicals, Globes says, as opponents use deal talk for political purposes in upcoming local elections. POT believes Israel Chemicals has no choice but to merge if it wants to stay relevant in the global fertilizer market in coming years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMRS

    Shares of Imris (IMRS -7.8%) slide today after pricing its 5.75M share offering at $3.50, a 2.2%...

    Shares of Imris (IMRS -7.8%) slide today after pricing its 5.75M share offering at $3.50, a 2.2% discount to yesterday's close. The gross proceeds are expected to be approximately $20.1M. Canaccord acted as sole book-runner and Cowen as co-manager.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • JCP

    Heard during J.C. Penney's (NYSE:JCP) talk at the BofA Consumer & Retail Conference: 1)...

    Heard during J.C. Penney's (NYSE:JCP) talk at the BofA Consumer & Retail Conference: 1) Self-funding seem to be in the playbook as the company says it aims to take non-core assets and use them as a source of cash. 2) "Lots of opportunities" on the expense side. 3) A bit of a brain teaser after CFO Ken Hannah discloses 30% of store employee hours is "non-selling" hours. 4) On attracting core customers who fled JCP,  expect more "gifts"  and an adjustment to the retailer's assortment. 5) Mistakes are admitted - but tactics are adapting for the "multi-year" journey. JCP +3.6% on the prospect of selling assets and the lack of any bombshell. (webcast), slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 13 Comments
  • STEC

    STEC (STEC +6.7%) is staring at big gains. The struggling enterprise solid-state drive maker...

    STEC (STEC +6.7%) is staring at big gains. The struggling enterprise solid-state drive maker presented at a Piper conference earlier today, and delivers its Q4 report after tomorrow's close. 17.1% of the float was shorted as of Feb. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • BHC

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG -28%) gets pummelled today after reporting disappointing FQ2 results...

    Synergetics (OTCQB:SURG -28%) gets pummelled today after reporting disappointing FQ2 results after the close yesterday. Revenues were well below estimates, though it included a one-time write down. Wunderlich cut the shares to Hold on the report, saying that revenues were disappointing pretty much across the board, though were especially impacted by inventory adjustments from OTCQB:SURG's OEM partners.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • ATML

    An upgrade to Buy from SunTrust Robinson leads Atmel (ATML +3.7%) to Outperform. The upgrade...

    An upgrade to Buy from SunTrust Robinson leads Atmel (ATML +3.7%) to Outperform. The upgrade comes a few days after Atmlel announced it's acquiring IDT's (NASDAQ:IDTI) smart meter chip business - products include a system-on-chip solution and an analog front end - for an undisclosed sum.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • NAVB

    The FDA has approved Navidea Biopharmaceutical's (NAVB -7.4%) Lymphoseek injection, a...

    The FDA has approved Navidea Biopharmaceutical's (NAVB -7.4%) Lymphoseek injection, a radioactive imaging agent meant to help doctors locate lymph nodes in patients with breast cancer or melanoma who are undergoing surgery to remove the lymph nodes. The drug, which is the first new lymph-node mapping agent approved in more than 30 years, is injected into the tumor area and later, using a hand-held radiation detector, identifies lymph nodes that have taken up Lymphoseek.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 8 Comments
  • ATOS

    Atossa Genetics (ATOS +17%) posts a healthy gain today after announcing a new deal for...

    Atossa Genetics (ATOS +17%) posts a healthy gain today after announcing a new deal for diagnostic laboratory testing with FedMed, a PPO working with over 550K providers, including 4K hospitals and more than 60K ancillary facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • AMX

    A downgrade to Neutral from HSBC sends America Movil (AMX -5.2%) shares tumbling. Credit Suisse...

    A downgrade to Neutral from HSBC sends America Movil (AMX -5.2%) shares tumbling. Credit Suisse issues a similar downgrade yesterday, but shares fell only modestly. Both ratings cuts follow the arrival of a bill that would create an independent regulator that would have the power to impose penalties on and perhaps even break up AMX's Mexican telecom ops. Grupo Televisa (TV -2%), also targeted by the bill, is down as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • EPB

    Credit Suisse grows more selective on MLPs, citing four whose valuations it thinks have grown...

    Credit Suisse grows more selective on MLPs, citing four whose valuations it thinks have grown excessive. El Paso Pipeline (EPB -1.9%) is cut to Neutral, as the firm sees decelerating distribution growth as drop-downs associated with the acquisition of El Paso Corp. by Kinder Morgan are absorbed. TLLP and EQM also are lowered, but CVR Refining (CVRR +1.9%) is raised to Outperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • SUMR

    Summer Infant (SUMR +13.4%) ramps higher despite a 4Q EPS miss as Needham upgrades the stock to...

    Summer Infant (SUMR +13.4%) ramps higher despite a 4Q EPS miss as Needham upgrades the stock to Strong Buy with a $4 price target. The firm says that although margin weakness doesn't seem like a reason for optimism, management's plan to cut costs and focus on profits over sales is significant, and with Q1 EPS expected to improve, it appears the company has turned a corner. Sidoti ups the stock to Buy as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • PHMD

    PhotoMedex (PHMD +1.8%) gains on a solid Q4 earnings beat this morning, reporting adjusted...

    PhotoMedex (PHMD +1.8%) gains on a solid Q4 earnings beat this morning, reporting adjusted non-GAAP earnings of $0.45 per share, up from $0.22 per share in Q4 2011. Total revenue beat analysts estimates as well, increasing 91% from the year prior. Consumer revenues +78% Y/Y, Direct-to-consumer channel revenues +67%, Distributor consumer channel +20%, Global retail and home shopping channel +158%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • VMW

    More on VMware: An aggressive long-term growth forecast is helping shares rally. VMware (VMW...

    More on VMware: An aggressive long-term growth forecast is helping shares rally. VMware (VMW +8.4%), currently expected by the Street to post 15% revenue growth this year and next, is forecasting 15%-20% annual growth from 2014-2016, as its efforts to expand its cloud/data center management and software-defined networking offerings bear fruit. VMware has slightly lowered its 2013 revenue guidance to account for the divesting of assets going into the Pivotal Initiative.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -4.3%) plunges near four-year lows, capping a 40% YTD decline....

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -4.3%) plunges near four-year lows, capping a 40% YTD decline. Cowen analysts see CLF's move to idle its Wabush Pointe Noire pellet plant as prudent but accompanying cost guidance seemed "aggressive." Given recent action in Chinese steel prices, the firm sees further downside risk to iron ore prices which could add increased pressure to CLF shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 10 Comments
  • MRK

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX +3.7%) moves up after reporting a Q4 loss that beat estimates. Revenue...

    Trius Therapeutics (TSRX +3.7%) moves up after reporting a Q4 loss that beat estimates. Revenue was also better, coming in at $5.2M, versus $5M the prior year. Net losses were higher, largely due to clinical and nonclinical development activities for tedizolid phosphate, our lead investigational drug in Phase 3 clinical development.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • MU

    Better late than never? Bernstein upgrades its stance on the global DRAM industry to Overweight,...

    Better late than never? Bernstein upgrades its stance on the global DRAM industry to Overweight, and in doing so helps Micron (MU +2.2%) make new 52-week highs. The first signs of improved pricing for PC DRAM arrived about two months ago, when Micron shares were much lower. Production cuts, along with the industry's consolidation around Micron, Samsung (OTC:SSNLF), and SK Hynix, have stabilized DRAM prices in spite of still-weak PC demand and slowing growth in the amount of DRAM included in the average PC.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • JCP

    Retail pressure cooker: Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP -2.8%) trade lower in front of a presentation...

    Retail pressure cooker: Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP -2.8%) trade lower in front of a presentation by the firm's CFO at a BofA retail conference. NBG's Brian Sozzi says one slip by the exec could send shares into a further freefall. The company's website indicates a webcast of the Q&A session will be available.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • FB

    Facebook's (FB -1.8%) mobile ad quality is declining, writes BTIG's Richard Greenfield in a...

    Facebook's (FB -1.8%) mobile ad quality is declining, writes BTIG's Richard Greenfield in a bearish note that's pressuring shares. Greenfield, who downgraded Facebook to Sell last month, thinks mobile ad sales could fall Q/Q in Q1 (a seasonally weak quarter), and that Street estimates for 2014 and beyond are too high.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 3 Comments
  • XIDEQ

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -0.7%) slips after Moody's lowers its credit ratings by one notch,...

    Exide Technologies (XIDE -0.7%) slips after Moody's lowers its credit ratings by one notch, citing the battery manufacturer's weak operating margins. It also cut its corporate family ratings to Caa1, seven steps into junk territory, from B3. The outlook is negative.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • CRUS

    "While we realize CRUS shares aren’t for every investor due to its Apple concentration, we...

    "While we realize CRUS shares aren’t for every investor due to its Apple concentration, we still believe that when investors return to AAPL shares, CRUS will get a much needed lift," writes Needham's Vernon Essi, coming to beaten-down Cirrus Logic's (CRUS +3.3%) defense. He also declares Cirrus is "unlikely" to lose its status as Apple's iPhone/iPad audio codec supplier. Shares now trade at just 6x FY14E (ends March '14) EPS, even as estimates fall due to iPhone-related concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • BIP

    Brookfield Infrastructure Partners (BIP -4.2%) continues to decline as damage from SA author...

    Brookfield Infrastructure Partners (BIP -4.2%) continues to decline as damage from SA author Roddy Boyd's skeptical weekend piece on its parent, Brookfield Asset Management (NYSE:BAM) spills over.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 4 Comments
  • BB

    "There is not and has not been any specific evaluation or activity underway regarding BlackBerry...

    "There is not and has not been any specific evaluation or activity underway regarding BlackBerry (BBRY -0.9%)," says a Lenovo (OTCPK:LNVGY) spokesman, discussing recent speculative remarks from CEO Yang Yuanqing. BlackBerry shares remain up 9.8% on the week. (Pac Crest)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 7 Comments
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere (NSPH +2.2%) said it's obtained the CE IVD Mark under the European Directive on In...

    Nanosphere (NSPH +2.2%) said it's obtained the CE IVD Mark under the European Directive on In Vitro Diagnostic Medical Devices for its gram-negative blood-culture test on the automated sample-to-result Verigene System. The CE IVD Mark is a requirement for in vitro diagnostic medical devices marketed in Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +1.8%) treks higher as the stock gets lined up once again by traders as...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +1.8%) treks higher as the stock gets lined up once again by traders as a "March Madness" play linked to the popularity of the restaurant chain during the annual NCAA basketball tournament. What do the charts say? BWLD at tournament time: 2011, 2012

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • VLO

    Since when is Macquarie such a market mover? Its downgrade of Valero (VLO -4.4%) is hitting...

    Since when is Macquarie such a market mover? Its downgrade of Valero (VLO -4.4%) is hitting refiners hard; the firm thinks the government's forced usage of biofuels is causing unintended consequences that will negatively impact refiners and may result in high RIN prices. Ratings for Holly Frontier (HFC -2.5%) and CVR Energy (CVI -3.3%) are cut too. Also: TSO -2.9%, WNR -3.7%, MPC -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 7 Comments
  • SSNI

    Silver Spring Networks (NYSE:SSNI) delivers a sterling IPO. After pricing its offering at $17...

    Silver Spring Networks (NYSE:SSNI) delivers a sterling IPO. After pricing its offering at $17 (the midpoint of its range), shares opened at $22 and are currently trading at $21.10, up 24.1%. That's good for a market cap of $955M, or 4.9x 2012 sales. 4.75M shares were sold in the IPO, 1M more than the maker of smart grid networking gear originally planned. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • BGMD

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD +14%) ramps higher after beating Q4 EPS estimates on a...

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD +14%) ramps higher after beating Q4 EPS estimates on a narrower-than-expected loss. Revenue jumped nearly 250% Y/Y, driven largely by increased sales of its BGM Galectin-3(NYSE:R) test, with product margins increasing 10% over the same period from 60% to 70%. Net losses also decreased by 38% Y/Y from $4.7M to $2.9M, primarily from an adjustment of accrued R&D expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • ANDX

    Tesoro Logistics (TLLP -4.8%) is downgraded to Neutral at both BAML and Credit Suisse on...

    Tesoro Logistics (TLLP -4.8%) is downgraded to Neutral at both BAML and Credit Suisse on valuation. "With a current yield of 3.1% vs. an average MLP sector yield of 6% and Tuesday's relative performance due to the addition of TLLP to the Alerian MLP Index, we now see TLLP as fairly valued," BAML writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • DELL

    EMC (EMC +1.1%) and VMware's (VMW +5.6%) Pivotal Initiative will be taken public, EMC CEO Joe...

    EMC (EMC +1.1%) and VMware's (VMW +5.6%) Pivotal Initiative will be taken public, EMC CEO Joe Tucci discloses during the companies' investor day (webcast). EMC will own 69% of the spinoff, and VMware 31%. Pivotal is headlined by EMC's Greenplum analytics database/hardware unit, but also features a slew of other product lines aimed at companies working on big data projects or developing Web/cloud apps. Given the hype surrounding Pivotal's addressable markets, the post-IPO valuation could be huge.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 7 Comments
  • CLMS

    Fans of Calamos Asset Mangement (CLMS -4%) may have a buying opportunity after Goldman...

    Fans of Calamos Asset Mangement (CLMS -4%) may have a buying opportunity after Goldman downgrades the fund manager to Sell, noting the company's stretched valuation even as it continues to bleed funds.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • HAS

    Keybanc cuts its rating on Hasbro (HAS -1.5%) to Hold from Buy due to what it calls the rich...

    Keybanc cuts its rating on Hasbro (HAS -1.5%) to Hold from Buy due to what it calls the rich current valuation on shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • PERI

    Perion Network (NASDAQ:PERI): Q4 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $21.4M (+90% Y/Y)....

    Perion Network (NASDAQ:PERI): Q4 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $21.4M (+90% Y/Y). Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • NFP

    National Financial Partners (NYSE:NFP) confirms receiving indications of interest from PE firms,...

    National Financial Partners (NYSE:NFP) confirms receiving indications of interest from PE firms, and forms a committee of independent directors to explore a potential sale of the company. NFP is the wealth management company headed by Sandy Weill's daughter Jessica Bibliowicz. Shares +11.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR) -5.2% after: 1) Guiding for 2013 semiconductor revenue of $940M-$990M and solar...

    MEMC (WFR) -5.2% after: 1) Guiding for 2013 semiconductor revenue of $940M-$990M and solar systems sales of 420MW-490MW, up from 2012 levels of $918M and 383MW. 2) Changing its name to SunEdison. 3) Announcing the creation of SunEdison Capital, a solar project financing arm. VP Carlos Domenech will head the unit. MEMC's Capital Markets Day starts at 11AM ET (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures hover around the unchanged mark in the wake of better...

    Market preview: Stock futures hover around the unchanged mark in the wake of better than-expected retails sales, with the S&P mini +0.1%. Boeing edges up 0.7% after receiving FAA approval for its battery modification plan, although Spectrum craters 36% following a sales warning. Later: Business Inventories
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
